name: Carol
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
路
3 weeks ago
,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Condo was in a great location and was clean. Took us a few minutes to find the exact unit though, but maybe we just misinterpreted the directions. The unit has a strange bathroom layout in that the toilet area is a step up from the vanity area so bring a nightlight if you go to the bathroom during the night. First night we had no issues at all. The second night however, the neighbor upstairs was walking heavily/stomping across the floor constantly from about 10:30 to at least 12:30 (confusing since it is such a small unit) so we were unable to sleep and then I never fell asleep after that until after 5am after more heavy walking around 4 am. No other reviews complained about the upstairs neighbor so maybe they had a guest in their unit?? I tried to read to relax but could not get bedside lamp to work. Bree was kind enough to mail back my pillow case after I left my pillow there and was sympathetic to the lack of sleep and planned to talk with the neighbor.

name: Ashley
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
路
3 weeks ago
,
路
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Brandons place was amazing! It was very easy to locate and from the moment we walked in we felt right at home. The home is as pictured and flows seamlessly. The kitchen was amazing and had everything we needed to prepare our meals. The game room and back yard are the stars of this home and the kids loved being able to have a fun space and utilize the fire pit for smores! The inclusion of bug spray, a lighter, wood and starter fluid made our night possible. Beds and sofas are extremely comfortable, bathrooms were clean and well stocked and the master bedroom has the best ceiling fan for those who like to stay cool. A/C works very well to keep the home comfortable and the inclusion of laundry and dishwasher pods was very helpful. Parking is located on a hill but levels out for walking. Lastly, the host is amazing and his communication level is top tier. We were grateful to stay here and cant wait to come back!
Fairhope Beach~25 min
Daphne Civic Center~15 min
Tanger Outlet~40 min

All flooring, countertops, and appliances have been updated, making it feel like a new condo. The location was quiet and tranquil. We loved the balcony, the comfy couch and big screen TV, the coffee bar, the night stand with built in charging station, and the blue-tooth speaker connected to the bathroom vent fan. Robin thought everything through so perfectly when designing the space with guests in mind.
We cant wait to stay again!
Note: Although your GPS may direct you differently, the unit is easier to locate by entering from Yacht Club Drive off US-98 and turning left into the property.

review_text:
Dear Beverley,
I want to express our heartfelt gratitude for being such an amazing host during our stay in your beautiful cottage in Daphne. Beverly was in contact with us even before we left the UK to make sure we had everything we needed.
The coziness and comfort of the cottage made our experience truly memorable. The town of Daphne, and its wonderful people, added an extra layer of charm to our visit.
Being greeted every morning by the local cat, Tippy, was a delightful touch that added to the overall warmth of our stay. Your attentiveness and responsiveness made us feel incredibly welcome, and nothing was too much trouble for you.
We highly recommend your Airbnb to others and look forward to staying with you again in the future. Thank you for creating such a wonderful experience for us.
Warm regards,
Dave & Laura

The cottage was off the Main Street so very quiet. 150% choose this cottage if staying on the Eastern Shore.

Beverly was a lovely host and her collage has everything we needed and more! The kitchen was well equipped and we had breakfast and some dinners there too. There is a full sized fridge and a dish washer. She has a table and chairs in the kitchen as well as another table and chairs and umbrella on a little outdoor patio, which is where I loved to eat! She also has another small deck with comfortable outdoor furniture where we also loved to unwind at the end of the day.
There is also a separate living room with 2 chairs, a loveseat, a table and a tv. The bedroom is separate with its own door and a bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. Everything was so clean.
Beverly has a stylishly decorated space. She was so thoughtful and left us a bottle of wine and some fresh bakery treats from a local bakery. Beverly was so friendly and I am glad we stayed there!

review_text: Troy and Susan were great! They were readily available if needed and otherwise offered excellent instructions for us to manage on our own during our stay. Accommodations were very clean and it was great to have the place to ourselves instead of staying in a hotel or other multi-occupant place. The view from the balcony was spectacular! We loved that Daphne provided an easy 1-hour commute to Dauphin Island to the West and 1-hour commute to Gulf Shores/Orange Beach to the East. It was our first airbnb experience and our first time in Alabama, and we would love to come back! Very friendly community as well with great restaurant options!

Thank you to Troy and Susan for allowing us to stay at Crab Shack again!
Beautiful sunsets just across the street (so nice to walk to the bluff and watch the sun set and the water fowl coming in for the evening), comfy bed (!!!!), water views from the deck (perfect for reading!), fun things do nearby (highly recommend a ride with Airboat Adventures!!!) and amazing food nearby (Moe's BBQ, Wacky Shrimp, East Shore Cafe...x3, and Original Oyster House didn't disappoint!).
We always feel spoiled staying this close to the bay. Being able to see the wildlife, waterfowl and spring flowers without a lot of traveling is splendid!

We stayed at the Crabshack for several days over our anniversary. It was nice to come home to a quiet place in a peaceful neighborhood after a day of exploring the area. The balcony was a pleasant place to begin and end a day. The view of the bay is just like the picture in the listing!
The shower was warm, the towels were soft, the bed was comfortable, and all the little details were taken care of. One morning, we rode the supplied bicycles and found more hills than we expected . We also walked down to the water at McMillan Landing.
To sum it up, this is a good base for exploring the surrounding Eastern Shore area and also a nice place to stay in or take quiet walks in the neighborhood. We look forward to returning!

Ahhh we absolutely loved our stay in the lovely loft. It was cozy and quaint and hosts had so many little touches that made all the difference- bottles of drinking water, travel size meds and bowl of chocolates. We were happy to have a toaster oven as it's our primary appliance we use and love.
The view of the water and peacefulness of all the mature trees and nearby Macmillan Bluff was just dreamy.
There was this little sound that was distracting to me at the start- my husband had to really strain to hear it. I figured out it was the fridge and we put some low music on and after the first night it didn't bother me.
We had a relaxing and quiet and restoring time together. Just what we needed.
Thank you!
We ate at the Dragonfly Tavern and it was bomb! Sooo delicious.

review_text:
So much nicer than staying in a hotel. We felt so spoiled being this close to the bay. The bed was comfortable, the towels were so soft and the whole loft was very clean. Check in and out were a breeze and the owners were so helpful to answer any questions we had!
Sitting on the deck reading books and walking down the little nature trail to the beach access across the road was the highlight of each day of our stay. The sunsets over the bay were lovely!
We ate at East Shore Cafe three times...Totally recommend! Other wonderful places to eat nearby are: Moe's BBQ, Whit's Frozen Custard, El Rancho, Wacky Shrimp and Guido's.
Also...visited the local park boardwalks, B&B Pecan Farm and enjoyed the wildlife and birds during a day trip down the eastern bay coast on Old 98.
Thank you to Troy and Susan for making our first AirBnb experience addicting. We pray the stars align in the future to be able to stay here again!

Weekend Gem!
Had a great weekend at this Airbnb in Olde Towne Daphne. The loft was very clean and the owners were always responsive. Perfect location near the Mobile Bay with access to everything around us within a 30 minute drive. We loved the porch and enjoyed sitting out to watch sunsets and the stars. Easy access to the property. The neighborhood is very quiet and the loft had a great AC and ceiling fan with cozy decor and even some little accessories you didnt remember to pack. The Keurig coffee machine and kitchenette were great. Enjoyed nearby Fairhope and Point Clear. We took a short drive over to Bellingrath Gardens and walked the beach on Dauphin Island. We would stay at this property again.

The loft is close to an awesome wine bar, about 0.8 mile walk. Its also close to a great yoga studio that offers great classes. There were snacks and water left for us which was a cute touch as well. We will be back!

路
Stayed with a pet
review_text: We had nine people and two dogs that stayed at Tammy's place for my graduation. Everything was as described. If desired, it can feel like two separate houses with the two living rooms, two kitchens, and two washer/dryers. Kitchens and rooms were fully stocked with everything we needed. As with anything with multiple stories though, be aware of sounds coming from the second floor if you are staying downstairs. Also, there is only the master bathroom downstairs so if someone else is staying in the second/spare bedroom, they will either have to share the bathroom with those staying in the master bedroom or go upstairs. We totally enjoyed staying here, we appreciated the Christmas decorations as it made it feel even homier. Parking was ample and the place was easy to find. If we are visiting Mobile and Tammy will have us in the future, we would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
This place was perfect! The house was exactly as pictured and described.
It was immaculately cleaned and well stocked with everything we needed.
The extra touch of having coffee available really made such an impression for us.
The other extra things provided like laundry detergent, starch for ironing, shampoo and other bath essentials made our 5 day stay a lot less stressful. (We were in town for a family wedding.)
Plenty of towels, pillows and extra blankets.
The size of the house was perfect for our family because there was plenty of room to spread out. There is a comfy breakfast nook or a large table in a different room.
The covered patio with fans and a large TV made our evenings at the house even more enjoyable. We felt very at home from the minute we arrived.
Tammy was responsive, friendly and very helpful when I had questions.
We will definitely stay here again when we come back to visit family!

The home is in a quiet walkable neighborhood. I loved the unique organization of bath towels in baskets in bedrooms and powder rooms!
This house is as pictured, with large rooms. Multiple areas to eat, read, watch TV. Tammy has earned her superhost status, responding within minutes when we had questions and making sure we had no issues with reservation, finding and entering the property. We will definitely seek to stay at her home for future trips to the area!

Not many hosts would do this!!! My parents absolutely loved it. I think my dad stayed in his pajamas all day until wedding duties called him out, and my daughter in law ordered door dash for her, her 2-year-old, and my parents. Definitely recommend this house!

review_text:
The house was as pictured. Cozy and comfortable, and able to host just a few folks or a big family dinner. The beds were just right.
The kitchen was great for light meals and 4-5 people. Anything more involved needs more utensils. We didn't see anything kid-sized for eating ware. We enjoyed using the grill in the back.
The couch was SO comfy! Once you get snuggled in, it's hard to want to leave. Especially when you have a good book.
We don't recommend putting the fan on in the room with the bunk bed if anyone is sleeping on the top bunk. Our boys loved the beds and the cool steps up to the top.
Tammy had all the baby stuff you could need and one of the rooms had a great selection of children's books.

review_text: We are from the area, so we already knew this place was going to be perfect...and it was! This home is so centrally located, and close to everything you could, or would want to do in Fairhope, Daphne, and Mobile. This sweet house is quiet, it was our sanctuary after a long day of visiting friends and shopping. It was genuinely nice to come home to a quiet reprieve. The beds are comfortable, the house is clean, the kitchen has just what you need to cook at home. There is a laundry room, if needed. We had a great sitting porch on the front with rockers as well. I really enjoyed our time here and would absolutely seek out Austin's place again when we come back for another visit. We absolutely loved it! Thank you!

Stayed with kids
review_text: We were first time Air B & B'ers. But the communication with Austin was easy and he was very responsive. The house was CLEAN and  bugs. Honestly, that was my biggest concern since we've had stays in hotels/condos before that was subpar when it came to cleanliness. I loved how he provided filled bottles of hand soap, paper towels, even extra toothbrushes (if needed). The TV had lots of choices of what to watch on it, minus the Auburn game but maybe he's an Alabama fan so he had the channel permanently deleted ぃ. There's even boardgames for the kids to play on too. My only negative comment i would have for the house would be the beds. I believe they were memory foam beds and more on stiffer side than I would prefer. My husband has back problems so it was great for him, but I prefer more plush. But honestly, you can't make everyone happy when it comes to beds since personal preferences varies so much. All in all, it was a great, clean, and affordable house to rent. We highly recommend!

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
I dont even know where to start!
Dwight (Dain), provided an extremely comfortable place for my family and I.
He accommodated to all our needs! (we had 2 dogs, 2 cats, and a newborn baby!)
He is very knowledgeable of the area, and is close-by if anything arises!
The condo is perfectly situated against a green-belt, and hes got private shades on one porch, a smoker, and a grill out back to use!
Its conveniently close to Publix, gas stations, food, EVERYTHING you need. Its right off highway 10, so it was very convenient for me to get to Mobile for work (10min tops).
Has 2 beds, 2 bathrooms, a dog gate if you need it. A full functioning kitchen with a toaster/coffee-maker, a washer and dryer that functions perfectly, and a very comfortable living room. 100mbps internet, perfect for work/streaming!
We felt very safe during our stay as well, with spot lights surrounding the entire property if you were to walk around it.
I cant thank Dain enough, STAY HERE! You wont regret it <3

review_text: Joel was friendly and professional from the start. Unfortunately I went to have some beach time but Mother Nature thought otherwise and ended up leaving two days early because of the weather and continued forecast of storms. I didnt ask for a refund nor expect one because Joel obviously cant control the weather but he graciously provided a refund for the unstayed days. I would stay again and would recommend the place for one person or a couple.

Joels condo was a little slice of heaven to come home to each day. The place is as described and had all the amenities and comfort of home. It was clean, the bed was comfortable and surroundings are quiet and peaceful. Shower temp and water pressure was great. No surprises or disappointments.
There were multiple stores close by, restaurants and Mobile Bay. The condo was a short drive to Mobile, Fairhope, Orange Beach, Gulf Shores, Dauphin Island and many more attractions/cities. We were able to visit all in our short 4 day stay.
Joel himself was awesome. His communication and instructions from booking through post check out was superb. He typically communicated first and responded within an hour if I messaged him. He was open to suggestions and left a great welcome packet with emergency info, places to go, shopping and anything you needed to know.
We will be back and Joels will be the first
on our list of places to stay! Thanks for helping make our vacation relaxing and fun!

name: Hilairie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
路
September 2021
,
路
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If there is a silver lining to our Hurricane Ida story, finding Joels condo is one of the shining threads. While searching last-minute for an evacuation spot from New Orleans, we were able to book this charming getaway. We couldnt have asked for a better place to land.
Leaving behind the conveniences of home was not as difficult as it might have been, as the condo had all the amenities that appealed to our aesthetic sensibilities and creature comforts. The layout of the condo is well-designed and the space was tastefully decorated. We especially appreciated having the private back porch (with sliding screened glass door), the no-issues WiFi, the king-size bed, and the perfectly-sized kitchenette with a roomy refrigerator. Not to be taken for granted was the the parking space conveniently located near the front door. But the icing on the cake was the proximity to the bay. What better way to end each day than a 5-minute walk to watch the colors of the setting sun emblazon the sky as it melts into the horizon?
As a host, Joel was extremely attentive, responsive, and accommodating. Considering the situation, he made us feel welcome and comfortable at a time of great uncertainty.
We hope to make it back one day, preferably next time under more relaxed circumstances. What a gem!
